Pemkot Baubau Ingin Dana CSR Tercatat Dalam Postur APBD
01 Nov 2019, 01:16 by Afrian Syah


Pemkot Baubau Ingin Dana CSR Tercatat Dalam Postur APBD

KBRN, Baubau : Pemerintah Kota Baubau, Sulawesi Tenggara(Sultra) menginginkan agar program pemberdayaan masyarakat yang anggarannya bersumber dari dana Corporate Sosial Responblity (CSR) bisa tercatat dalam postur APBD.Kepala Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Daerah(Bappeda) Baubau, La Ode Aswad mengakui selama ini perusahaan melalui dana CSRnya sudah banyak membantu Pemkot Baubau dengan melaksanakan program-program pemberdayaan masyarakat. Hanya saja menurutnya, program tersebut belum terarah dan tidak tercatat dalam postur APBD sebagai sumbangan pihak ketiga dalam mendukung program pemerintah. "Mereka (perusahaan) sudah banyak membantu, misalnya program Galeri Tenun Bank Indonesia di kelurahan Sulaa. Tapi tetap saja kita tidak bisa catat dalam mekanisme APBD bahwa itu sumbangan pihak ketiga," ujar Aswad saat ditemui diruang kerjanya, Kamis(31/10/2019). Karena itu, lanjut Aswad, Pemkot Baubau berencana merancang sebuah peraturan daerah(Perda) agar program yang didanai CSR bisa masuk dalam postur APBD. Namun, terlebih dulu pihaknya akan membangun kesempatan dengan semua perusahaan, baik BUMN, BUMD maupun swasta agar siap mendukung semua Visi-Misi Pemkot Baubau. Dengan begitu, lanjut dia, bila Perda telah terbit maka perusahaan sudah bisa dilibatkan lansung mendanai program-program pemerintah yang benar-benar dibutuhkan masyarakat. "Perda ini mudahan-mudahan secepatnya sudah bisa dibahas. Begitu sudah ada payung hukumnya maka perusahaan sudah bisa kita ajak untuk memilih program mana yang bisa didanai.Tapi tentunya hanya program pemberdayaan masyarakat. Sehingga bisa tercatat dalam APBD kita bahwa program tersebut didanai pihak ketiga," jelasnya. Aswad menambahkan, dalam memuluskan terbitnya Perda tersebut, sebagai langkah awal Pemkot Baubau sudah membentuk Forum Komunikasi CSR dengan melibatkan sejumlah perusahaan yang dikoordinir oleh Bappeda. Forum tersebut lanjut dia bertujuan untuk memastikan agar pemanfaatan dana CSR bisa transparan dan tepat sasaran sesuai kebutuhan yang dinginkan masyarakat. "Jadi dalam forum ini Bappeda mengkoordinasikan agar sifatnya satu pintu. Contoh bila ada program, maka tinggal kita minta perusaahaan mana yang bersedia mendanai agar dana tersebut pemanfaatannya tepat sasaran," pungkasnya.

Baubau City Government Wants CSR Funds to Be Recorded in APBD Posture
Nov 01 2019, 01:16 by Afrian Syah


Baubau City Government Wants CSR Funds to Be Recorded in APBD Posture

KBRN, Baubau: The City Government of Baubau, Southeast Sulawesi (Southeast Sulawesi) wants that the community empowerment program whose budget is sourced from Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) funds can be recorded in the posture of the APBD. Head of the Regional Development Planning Agency (Bappeda) Baubau, La Ode Aswad acknowledged during this company through its CSR funds has helped Baubau City Government a lot by implementing community empowerment programs. It's just according to him, the program has not been directed and not recorded in the posture of the regional budget as a third party contribution in supporting government programs. "They (the company) have helped a lot, for example the Bank Indonesia Weaving Gallery program in the village of Sulaa. But still, we cannot note in the APBD mechanism that it is a third party contribution," Aswad said when met in his office on Thursday (10/31/2019) ). Therefore, continued Aswad, the Baubau City Government planned to draft a regional regulation (Perda) so that CSR-funded programs could be included in the APBD posture. However, first his party will build opportunities with all companies, both BUMN, BUMD and the private sector to be ready to support all Baubau City Government Vision-Missions. That way, he continued, if the Regional Regulation has been issued, the company can be directly involved in funding government programs that are really needed by the community. "Hopefully this regulation can be discussed as soon as possible. Once there is a legal umbrella, we can invite companies to choose which programs can be funded. But of course only community empowerment programs. So that it can be recorded in our APBD that the program is funded by a third party, "he explained. Aswad added, in smoothing the issuance of the regulation, as a first step the Baubau City Government had formed a CSR Communication Forum involving a number of companies coordinated by Bappeda. The forum he continued aims to ensure that the utilization of CSR funds can be transparent and targeted to meet the needs of the public. "So in this forum Bappeda coordinates the one-door nature. For example, if there is a program, then we only need to ask which company is willing to fund so that the utilization of the funds is right on target," he concluded.
